title: San Bernardino's view of Trump's travel restrictions
text: "I moved to Oxnard in December 1964. We had hardly any Mexican restaurants in Boston back then. My husband sent me to get tacos — five for $1. I had never heard of a taco, so all the way in I kept saying, "taco, taco." I was afraid I would say it incorrectly. We are now back in Boston and have plenty of Mexican restaurants. We know the whole menu and have tried most of it."
summary:
We had hardly any Mexican restaurants in Boston back then.
My husband sent me to get tacos — five for $1.
I had never heard of a taco, so all the way in I kept saying, "taco, taco."
We are now back in Boston and have plenty of Mexican restaurants.
We know the whole menu and have tried most of it."
